definition: surname Yin/abbr. for 印度[Yin4 du4]
to print/to mark/to engrave/a seal/a print/a stamp/a mark/a trace/image
to brush/to paint/to daub/to paste up/to skip class (of students)/to fire from a job

sentences.english: Please write your name and address in print.
sentences.chinese: 姓名和地址请用印刷体书写。

sentences.english: This is thenichethattypography enthusiasts guard with fervor.
sentences.chinese: 但印刷体爱好者还是热衷此道。

sentences.english: Please print your names in the application form.
sentences.chinese: 在申请表上请用印刷体写好姓名。

sentences.english: There's a telegraph form. Please write your telegram in block letters.
sentences.chinese: 给你电报稿纸，请用印刷体书写电报。

sentences.english: Please write your telegram in block letters.
There are two forms of the Chinese phonetic alphabet, the cursive and the printed.
sentences.chinese: 汉语拼音字母有手写体和印刷体两种体式。
请用印刷体写清你的地址。

sentences.english: Please write down your full name in block letters.
sentences.chinese: 请用印刷体写上你的全名。

sentences.english: But it is not in manuscript: it is printed.''

definition: to write without lifting one's pen from the paper
Chinese character/CL:個|个[ge4]/Japanese: kanji/Korean: hanja/Vietnamese: hán tự
style of writing (literary style)/way of writing a character/spelling
piece of paper with short note/short letter
Hanyu Pinyin, the romanization system used in the PRC since the 1960s
